name: Shadowfax
description:
'''Shadowfax''' was a [[New-age music|new-age]]/[[electronic music|electronic]] musical group formed in Chicago in the early 1970s and best known for their albums ''[[Shadowfax (album)|Shadowfax]]'' and ''[[Folksongs for a Nuclear Village]]''. In 1989, they won the Grammy for Best New Age Performance for ''Folksongs for a Nuclear Village''. In 1993, they were nominated for the Grammy for ''[[Esperanto (Shadowfax album)|Esperanto]]''.

The group formed in 1972 and disbanded after 1995 when [[lyricon]] player and leader [[Chuck Greenberg (musician)|Chuck Greenberg]] died of a heart attack. Having lost their signature sound, Shadowfax's members went on to other projects.

The group took its name from [[Gandalf the Grey]]'s horse [[Shadowfax (Middle-earth)|Shadowfax]] in [[J. R. R. Tolkien]]'s ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.
